definition: to take the lead/to be first to (do sth)/to pioneer
to raise/to dig up/to poke/to prick/to incite/to stir up
to carry on a shoulder pole/to choose/to pick/to nitpick
suffix for nouns
head/hair style/the top/end/beginning or end/a stub/remnant/chief/boss/side/aspect/first/leading/classifier for pigs or livestock/CL:個|个[ge4]
erhua variant of 挑頭|挑头[tiao3 tou2]

sentences.english: The lead bull is on his own, well out in front.
sentences.chinese: 领头的公牛独自挑头，走在最前面。

definition: to stand out (among a group)/distinguished
to cause trouble/to create a disturbance
to urge sb on
to incite/to stir up/to instigate
to take the lead/to be the first/to set an example
to try to smooth things over/to paper over the issues/to gloss things over
to put on a rival show (idiom); to set oneself up against sb/to get into confrontation
timid/to be afraid of getting involved/to be afraid of getting into trouble
sb who goes whichever way the wind blows/sb with no mind of their own/easily swayed person/opportunist
to issue a call for action/to raise one's hand and issue a rousing call (idiom)
to adopt confrontational posture/to meet head-on/to compete
to sit on the fence/to take both sides in a dispute
to take the blame/to be a scapegoat/to carry the can
to pick a quarrel/to start a fight
to back sb up/to support sb in an argument/(lit. to beat nearby drum)
to reconcile/to mediate/to bring warring parties to agreement/to arbitrate
